subject: College Athletics
lead_paragraph: Saying the N.C.A.A. has new information, Myles Brand, the president of the N.C.A.A., promised to investigate the former Southern California star O. J. Mayo, who allegedly received thousands of dollars in gifts from money given to an event promoter by a sports agency. On Sunday, ESPN reported that Bill Duffy Associates provided Rodney Guillory with about $200,000 before Mayo arrived at U.S.C. Louis Johnson, a former associate of Mayo, told the program “Outside the Lines” that Mayo received about $30,000 and other benefits from Guillory while in high school and during his one season with the Trojans.
